channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Hubble révèle une énigmatique galaxie composée presque uniquement de matière noire !
item.description: Depuis un siècle, les télescopes ne cessent de nous montrer à quel point est riche et varié le fameux « Royaume des nébuleuses » de Edwin Hubble pour reprendre le titre d'un célèbre ouvrage de l'astronome états-unien. Le télescope portant son nom continue à contribuer à notre étonnement et notre...

item.title: Wizards of the Coast Has a Very Long Explanation for Why It Changed Raph’s Weapon in the Ninja Turtles ‘Magic’ Set
item.description: No, it's not an art error: Raph's weapon of choice has had a bit of a tweak for the new 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles' set for 'Magic: The Gathering.'

item.title: Epilogue GB Operator Review: Play Your Game Boy Games on a Laptop
item.description: Epilogue’s adorable GB Operator plug-in gizmo is a must-have for collectors of retro Nintendo Game Boy games.

item.title: Meta will ruin its smart glasses by being Meta
item.description: Whenever I write about Meta's Ray-Ban smart glasses, I already know the comments I'm going to get. Cool hardware, but hard pass on anything Meta makes; will wait for someone else to come along. It's hard to imagine that sentiment changing anytime soon after The New York Times reported that Meta mulled launching facial recognition […]

item.title: US website 'freedom.gov' will allow Europeans to view hate speech and other blocked content
item.description: The US State Department is building a web portal, where Europeans and anyone else can see online content banned by their governments, according to Reuters. It was supposed to be launched at Munich Security Conference last month, but some state department officials reportedly voiced their concerns about the project. The portal will be hosted on freedom.gov, which currently just shows the image above. “Freedom is Coming,” the homepage reads. “Information is power. Reclaim your human right to free expression. Get Ready.”Reuters says officials discussed making a virtual private network function av...

item.title: Tesla’s cheaper $60,000 Cybertruck is still a Cybertruck
item.description: Tesla has announced a new all-wheel drive Cybertruck that starts at $59,990, the cheapest the controversial truck has been sold for yet - though still well above the $40,000 price tag Elon Musk had initially promised. It's been joined by a $15,000 price cut for the high-end Cyberbeast variant, as Tesla doubles down on its […]

item.title: The OpenAI mafia: 18 startups founded by alumni
item.description: The OpenAI mafia: 15 of the most notable startups founded by alumni

item.title: LA County lawsuit accuses Roblox of exposing children to 'grooming and exploitation'
item.description: Los Angeles County has sued Roblox for "unfair and deceptive business practices," claiming the platform's moderation and age-verification systems are inadequate. "Roblox portrays its platform as a safe and appropriate place for children to play," the complaint states. "In reality, and as Roblox well knows, the design of its platform makes children easy prey for pedophiles." Representatives accused Roblox of failing to implement adequate platform safety features to prevent child endangerment. "Specifically, Roblox has not effectively moderated game content or enforced age-appropriate restricti...

item.title: To celebrate The Legend of Zelda’s 40th anniversary, I’m splashing out on some of the best merch and games the franchise has to offer
item.description: The Legend of Zelda turns 40 today, meaning there's no better time to shop for the best merch, games and accessories

item.title: Running a busy small business? This Epson WorkForce Pro office printer does it all - and it's almost half price at just $130
item.description: Epson WorkForce Pro color all-in-one inkjet printer is nearly half price at just $130

item.title: Ce SSD interne 2 To dédié à la PS5 coûte moins de 230 €, un prix qui devient rare en pleine hausse des tarifs
item.description: L'augmentation des tarifs des SSD se poursuit, mais il n'est quand même pas impossible de dénicher de belles offres sur ce marché. Par exemple, le Seagate Game Drive de 2 To, taillé pour la PlayStation 5, est proposé à 229,99 euros au lieu de 254,99 euros par Carrefour.

item.title: Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen are coming to Switch next week for the series’ 30th anniversary
item.description: It’s a big month for Pokémon, with February 27 marking 30 years since the world’s highest-grossing media franchise first introduced itself in the shape of two Game Boy games. Pocket Monsters Red and Pocket Monsters Green, which later arrived in the West as Pokémon Red and Pokémon Blue, kicked off a craze in Japan that would soon spread worldwide. And to mark the series’ 30th anniversary, the little turn-based RPGs that started it all are being re-released on Nintendo Switch. Well, sort of. The versions we’re actually getting are the Game Boy Advance remakes, Pokémon FireRed Version and Pokémon...

item.title: The Morning After: What to expect from Apple’s March 4 hardware event
item.description: Apple has lined up its first event of the year. Already! It’s taking place in New York City on March 4 at 9AM ET, but the company hasn’t confirmed if it will stream the media event. It seems likely the event will be mainly iPads and MacBooks — so business as usual. However, it could include new entry-level MacBooks in a fresh array of colors. I think that’s what everyone’s reading into the lemon-and-lime tinged invitation. I’m very much up for a return of the colorful Mac. The first Mac I ever used was one of those bubbly orange iMacs, interning at a video-game magazine. Yes, a magazine. We’re...

item.title: The DJI Osmo Pocket 4 has leaked in a new video – and it might just have escaped the US ban
item.description: It looks as though the DJI Osmo Pocket 4 is about to launch, and here's a hands-on video look at it.

item.title: Boldr Kelvin Review (2026): Heats Your Body, Heats the Wall
item.description: The Boldr Kelvin heater looks cool and promises energy savings and far-infrared heat. Too bad it also heats backward.

item.title: Who's watching who? Experts reveal criminals using fake enterprise software to gain access to company systems
item.description: Someone put in a lot of effort to hide a RAT in plain sight, and even make money along the way.

item.title: 'Now that's home theater': Optoma's new 4K projector boasts Dolby Vision, HDR10+, hits 5000 lumens, 240Hz, and reaches 300 inches
item.description: Optoma's new flagship projector is super-bright, super-stuffed with screen tech, and made for big screens

item.title: This high-speed beginner-friendly 3D printer deal is a great place to start testing out your 3D printing skills - the Flashforge Adventurer 5M is down to $239
item.description: Flashforge Adventurer 5M beginner-friendly 3D printer drops to just $239 after discounts.

item.title: Ubisoft has laid off more developers amid its ongoing cost-cutting plan, this time at its Splinter Cell remake studio but says the game is still in the works
item.description: Ubisoft confirms the Splinter Cell Remake is still in active development, as it lays off even more staff as part of its ongoing cost-cutting scheme

item.title: Pourquoi Tesla a subitement retiré son Autopilot aux USA : doit-on craindre la même chose en Europe ?
item.description: Tesla a subitement retiré sa fonction phare, l'Autopilot, aux États-Unis. Et on commence maintenant à comprendre pourquoi. La grande question est désormais de savoir si la firme américaine supprimera également l'Autopilot en Europe à terme.

item.title: Google Pixel 10a vs Pixel 9a : quelles sont les vraies différences ?
item.description: Ne vous laissez pas avoir par le nouveau design. Sous le capot du Pixel 10a, c'est exactement le moteur du 9a qui ronronne. On a passé les deux fiches techniques à la moulinette pour savoir si l'évolution justifie réellement de passer à la caisse ou s'il vaut mieux vider les stocks de l'an dernier.

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Is a Ratings Slam Dunk
item.description: The 'Game of Thrones' spin-off has averaged more viewers per episode than HBO's Emmy-winning hit 'The Pitt.'

item.title: Could AI Data Centers Be Moved to Outer Space?
item.description: Massive data centers for generative AI are bad for the Earth. How about launching them into orbit?

item.title: How to Layer Your Clothes to Stay Warm in Any Season (2026)
item.description: Whether you’re hiking, climbing, or backpacking, here’s how to use base layers, mid layers, and a shell to be comfortable no matter what nature throws at you.

item.title: I tested two different 4K Blu-rays of the same movie — and it pays to research which version you're getting
item.description: Ever wondered how two different 4K Blu-rays of the same movie compare? I tested Arrow Video and Paramount versions of The Warriors to see how different they really were.

item.title: How Meta’s high-stakes trial could have ripple effects across other industries
item.description: Insurance companies, for example, could see a rise in claims for digital or social media addiction treatment. Meta founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg took the stand Wednesday to defend his company’s practices in a landmark trial that could determine whether social media companies can be held liable for alleged harms to children. But if the defendants lose, the implications could extend far beyond social media....

item.title: UAE’s G42 teams up with Cerebras to deploy 8 exaflops of compute in India
item.description: Abu Dhabi-based tech company G42 has partnered with U.S.-based chipmaker Cerebras to deploy eight exaflops of compute through a new system in India

item.title: Sommet à New Delhi | Les États-Unis rejettent une gouvernance mondiale de l’intelligence artificielle
item.description: Les États-Unis ont rejeté vendredi toute gouvernance mondiale de l’IA vendredi, avant une déclaration des dirigeants du monde entier réunis en Inde sur l’intelligence artificielle.

item.title: Will Microsoft ever stop messing with Notepad? Windows 11 app could soon get another feature — and I'm predicting a backlash
item.description: Is Notepad getting too bloated these days? If you're of that opinion, you won't like what Microsoft has planned next.

item.title: Des puces à toutes les sauces : comment AMD prévoirait de diffuser largement ses futurs processeurs Zen 6
item.description: De nouvelles informations suggèrent qu'AMD travaillerait à l'élaboration d'une gamme très étoffée de processeurs « Olympic Ridge », sous architecture Zen 6. À la clé, des références 10 cœurs, voire 20 cœurs, relativement inhabituelles.

item.title: WhatsApp is lifting a frustrating group-chat limitation I’ve hated for years — giving it the upper hand over iMessage and Telegram
item.description: WhatsApp is rolling out Group Message History, which lets new chat members easily catch up on messages posted before they joined.

item.title: Wisconsin scraps VPN ban from age verification bill following backlash
item.description: Lawmakers hear the concerns of VPN users across the country, removing VPN blocking requirements from the age verification bill. Yet, experts warn that the proposed law still comes with some major issues.

item.title: How to write effective prompts for AI website builders
item.description: Master these AI website builder prompting tips to create professional sites faster. Learn proven techniques for getting exactly what you need from your AI tool.

item.title: Garmin just added a bunch of new features to its best smartwatch
item.description: The Fenix 8 has had a big update, Software Version 21.25, containing a whole host of new fixes and glances.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 tourne localement sur Android, ce smartphone réalise un exploit
item.description: Faire tourner le jeu PC Cyberpunk 2077 sur un smartphone Android sans passer par le cloud ? Le RedMagic 11 Pro réussit ce pari fou grâce à l'émulation et son refroidissement extrême.

item.title: Iron Age Surgeons Fixed a Woman’s Shattered Jaw With Primitive Prosthetic—and She Survived
item.description: Researchers revisited a 2,500-year-old mummified skull, uncovering signs of an extreme surgical procedure—which the ancient woman survived.

item.title: The Best Mushroom Gummies on the Market, Lab-Approved (2026)
item.description: These edibles made from functional fungi are not your childhood Flintstone vitamins.

item.title: Meet Scotland’s Whisky-Sniffing Robot Dog
item.description: Inside Dewar’s cavernous whisky warehouses, man’s best mechanical friend—a Boston Dynamics robot dog with an ethanol sensor for a nose—is on the hunt for leaky barrels.

item.title: Anthropic is fighting with a big client, and it’s actually good for its brand
item.description: The AI company’s squabble with the Department of Defense is another way to burnish its reputation. Can a headline-making squabble with a client actually be good for a brand? This week’s dispute between the Department of Defense and Anthropic, a high-profile player in the super-competitive field of artificial intelligence, may be just that.

item.title: Samsung updates Bixby to become more conversational
item.description: Bixby isn’t typically part of the conversation when it comes to virtual assistants for mobile devices, but Samsung is clearly hoping that you would use it more. The company has launched the latest version of Bixby with the new One UI 8.5 beta, and it has been tweaked to work as a “conversational agent.” Samsung says you’ll now be able to talk to it and give it tasks using natural language, like how you’d talk to other people or, these days, to chatbots. You don’t have to remember exact commands or names for specific settings. You can just describe what you want to happen, such as “I don’t want...

item.title: Recent AWS outages blamed on AI tools - at least two incidents took down Amazon services
item.description: Misconfigured AI tools were responsible for two recent AWS outages – Amazon asserts they were "user error, not AI error."

item.title: Voici la consommation réelle et scandaleuse des hybrides rechargeables vendues en Europe : 30 marques passées au crible, Porsche et Toyota à l’opposé
item.description: Une nouvelle étude basée sur les données issues de "mouchards" installés sur près d'un million de voitures en Europe enfonce le clou : les voitures hybrides rechargeables sont un scandale pour le consommateur et la planète. Surtout, certaines marques s'en sortent mieux que d'autres. Décryptage.

item.title: Cette batterie externe de 10 000 mAh, compatible MagSafe, est bradée à -33 % sur Amazon
item.description: Avec l'Ugreen Nexode de 20 W disponible pour 26,99 euros chez Amazon au lieu de 39,99 euros, vous aurez dans votre poche une batterie externe capable de recharger votre smartphone, votre tablette ou encore votre montre connectée.

item.title: Google just upgraded Gemini again, and 3.1 Pro more than doubles its AI reasoning power — but some users aren’t impressed
item.description: Google’s new Gemini 3.1 Pro dramatically boosts AI reasoning — but some users say it feels less human in the process

item.title: The AI mistake most enterprises don’t discover until it’s too late
item.description: Why single-channel AI wins become multi-channel scalability problems later.

item.title: 3 raisons de craquer pour le tout nouveau Google Pixel 10a avant le 18 mars sur le Google Store [Sponso]
item.description: Grosse offre de reprise et réductions importantes sur les accessoires : Google met les petits plats dans les grands pour la sortie de son nouveau smartphone
